alluxio.client.block

Class BlockStoreContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • alluxio.client.block.BlockStoreContext

  • @ThreadSafe
public final class BlockStoreContext
extends Object
    A shared context for each master for common block master client functionality such as a pool of master clients and a pool of local worker clients. Any remote clients will be created and destroyed on a per use basis.

    NOTE: The context maintains a pool of block master clients and a pool of block worker clients that are already thread-safe. Synchronizing BlockStoreContext methods could lead to deadlock: thread A attempts to acquire a client when there are no clients left in the pool and blocks holding a lock on the BlockStoreContext, when thread B attempts to release a client it owns, it is unable to do so, because thread A holds the lock on BlockStoreContext.

        Gets a context with the specified master address from the cache if it's created before. Otherwise creates a new one and puts it in the cache.
        Parameters:
        masterAddress - the master's address
        Returns:
        the context created or cached before

        Returns:

      • createWorkerClient

        public BlockWorkerClient createWorkerClient(WorkerNetAddress address)
                                     throws IOException
        Creates a client for a worker with the given address.
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the worker to get a client to
        Returns:
        a BlockWorkerClient connected to the worker with the given worker RPC address
        Throws:
        IOException - if it fails to create a client for a given hostname (e.g. no Alluxio worker is available for the given worker RPC address)

      • acquireNettyChannel

        public static io.netty.channel.Channel acquireNettyChannel(InetSocketAddress address,
                                                           Callable<io.netty.bootstrap.Bootstrap> bootstrapBuilder)
                                                    throws IOException
        Acquires a netty channel from the channel pools. If there is no available client instance available in the pool, it tries to create a new one. And an exception is thrown if it fails to create a new one.
        Parameters:
        address - the network address of the channel
        bootstrapBuilder - the bootstrap builder that creates a new bootstrap upon called
        Returns:
        the acquired netty channel
        Throws:
        IOException - if it fails to create a new client instance mostly because it fails to connect to remote worker

      • releaseNettyChannel

        public static void releaseNettyChannel(InetSocketAddress address,
                                       io.netty.channel.Channel channel)
        Releases a netty channel to the channel pools.
        Parameters:
        address - the network address of the channel
        channel - the channel to release

      • acquireBlockWorkerThriftClient

        public static BlockWorkerClientService.Client acquireBlockWorkerThriftClient(InetSocketAddress address)
                                                                      throws IOException
        Acquires a block worker thrift client from the block worker thrift client pools. If there is no available client instance available in the pool, it tries to create a new one. And an exception is thrown if it fails to create a new one.
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the block worker
        Returns:
        the block worker thrift client
        Throws:
        IOException - if it fails to create a new client instance mostly because it fails to connect to remote worker

      • releaseBlockWorkerThriftClient

                                                  BlockWorkerClientService.Client client)
        Releases the block worker thrift client to the pool.
        Parameters:
        address - the network address of the block worker thrift client
        client - the block worker thrift client

      • acquireBlockWorkerThriftClientHeartbeat

        public static BlockWorkerClientService.Client acquireBlockWorkerThriftClientHeartbeat(InetSocketAddress address)
                                                                               throws IOException,
                                                                                      InterruptedException
        Acquires a block worker thrift client from the block worker thrift client pools dedicated for heartbeat. If there is no available client instance available in the pool, it tries to create a new one. And an exception is thrown if it fails to create a new one.
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the block worker
        Returns:
        the block worker thrift client
        Throws:
        IOException - if it fails to create a new client instance mostly because it fails to connect to remote worker
        InterruptedException - if this thread is interrupted
